revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus over the Sun in 1761
tldr: This article reports the observation of the Transit of Venus over the Sun on June 6, 1761, in Calcutta, Bengal. The authors, Charles Morton and William Magee, recorded the event using a stopwatch and made corrections to the observed times based on the watch's accuracy. The observations provide valuable data for understanding the transit and refining astronomical knowledge of the time.
